content: guess we should file an unmaintained crate advisory https://github.com/sodiumoxide/sodiumoxide/commit/5bb1dfd2578539b89ffb0cbea25f21f00cfb963e
maybe some sort of de facto successor fork will emerge

I wanted to clarify what constitutes "unmaintained", actually. The original use case was for rustcrypto crate that nobody had upload access to, so there was literally no way to publish updates, even security updates.
Since this crate states that security updates will still be merged, I don't think it's warranted here.

I'm in the "happy situation" that I have a project still using rust_sodium, that I wanted to migrate to sodiumoxide. And now both are unmaintained :/

I need secretbox (xsalsa20poly1305) and box (curve25519xsalsa20poly1305). Is there some pure-rust crate (or two) that implements both? It seems there's https://github.com/RustCrypto/AEADs/tree/master/xsalsa20poly1305 that could replace secretbox, but what about box?

Tony Arcieri said:

Danilo https://github.com/RustCrypto/nacl-compat/tree/master/crypto_box

Oh, awesome! Thanks for the link.
opened an issue about this for further discussion https://github.com/rustsec/advisory-db/issues/1090
